data.title: When saving a .js file, atom deletes then rewrites the document with the insertion point at the first line
data.body:
# Specs:
### Atom v1.8.0
### Windows 7 Enterprise
## Expected:

**To save a file and maintain my current line & column position \ insertion point in the edit window**
## What occurs:

Very annoying bug especially with mass amounts of lines of code:

Not sure why or when it happens, sometimes even breaks my gulp-watching if the bug 'times' correctly
#### 1. I initiate a save on a js file which then gulp notices and reloads my browser to reflect changes
#### 2. Nearly EVERY save, atom will: erase the whole document, then reload document (changes are still there) with the editing cursor at line 1 col 1.
#### 3. If timed correctly, when the Atom erases the document, gulp reads a blank js file and throws an error and breaks my browser-sync / watch-server

_(I know it's erasing content and reloading simply because I ctrl-z'd after a save and it stepped-back into a blank document; one more undo and I see all my content with the change I made prior to saving)_

![linter_save_bug_1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7283359/17160335/24ae5d0e-5359-11e6-8e06-a522b50eada2.PNG)
_Prior to edit_

![linter_save_bug_2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7283359/17160344/29b3eeea-5359-11e6-9245-17b9919dd5ac.PNG)
_Edit made_

![linter_save_bug_3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7283359/17160356/3cf42722-5359-11e6-8b52-17674f6e65d1.PNG)
_Atom erasing/reloading document after save_

![linter_save_bug_4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7283359/17160358/416087d8-5359-11e6-9d83-7157c0aa36cf.PNG)
_Document reloaded, insertion point at line 1_

![linter_save_bug_5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7283359/17160362/45a7923c-5359-11e6-80b4-262a7ae3e0e9.PNG)
_Saved edit (after scrolling back down to find line)_

data.title: Cycling through Atom windows on macOS doesn't respect the shift key to reverse direction.
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Cycling through Atom windows on macOS doesn't (anymore?) respect the shift key to reverse direction.  I'm almost sure that it used to work.  Other native mac apps respect the shift key to reverse cycle direction. (e.g. Chrome, iTerm, etc.)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. have at least 3 atom windows open on macOS
2. hit cmd+` (it should cycle to the second open window)
3. hit cmd+shift+`

**Expected behavior:**

It cycles back to the first window.

**Actual behavior:**

It cycles to the third window.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
### Related Issues / Research

It appears that this feature has completely stopped working in the past: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/10852
Did the fix from back then not fully restore the correct functionality?

There's also this issue, which I think is unrelated, because I'm using a standard US keyboard: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/11531

data.title: Atom Helper CPU Usage High
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Atom and system is slow on a 8 core Mac Pro 3,1 after upgrade to latest Sierra PB2 and latest Atom Beta.

After upgrading to Sierra PB2.  Atom beta for 10.12 suggested an upgrade and launched it immediately in the background.  Now the Atom Helper is causing beachballs (I think?).  didn't happen on the previous Sierra PB1 or Atom beta.

Ran atom-beta --safe to no avail.

Also have normal atom co-installed.  They can live together no?

Please help.
### Steps to Reproduce

See above

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
### Versions

atom-beta --version
Atom    : 1.9.0-beta1
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

apm-beta --version
apm  1.10.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.8.4

data.title: hitting space scrolls page while searching for packages to install
data.body:
### Description

searching for packages to install, when you type space into the search bar, the page scrolls
### Steps to Reproduce
1. open settings
2. go to install tab
3. type a space into the search bar

**Expected behavior:**

page stays still while I type

**Actual behavior:**

both a space character is entered and the page scrolls
### Versions

Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
on mac OSX

data.title: Cleanup activationHookSubscriptions when deactivating package
data.body:
Without this fix, the included test would fail with:

```
$ ./out/Atom.app/Contents/MacOS/Atom --test --resource-path="$(pwd)" -- spec/package-manager-spec.coffee
(electron) submitURL is now a required option to crashReporter.start
Error Downloading Update: Could not get code signature for running application
---------------------------------.F.---------------------------------------

PackageManager
  ::activatePackage(id)
    when the package metadata includes `activationHooks`
      it does not double register activation hooks when deactivating and reactivating
        Expected 2 to be 1.
          at .<anonymous> (/Users/asuarez/src/atom/atom/spec/package-manager-spec.coffee:444:49)
        Expected 3 to be 2.
          at .<anonymous> (/Users/asuarez/src/atom/atom/spec/package-manager-spec.coffee:455:49)
```

cc: @hansonw

data.title: HTML Preview error and crash after saving
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [Yes ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [Yes ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [YES ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [YES ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [YES (Assumed, Not Know) ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [YES ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

[The HTML Preview window will go blank after saving, does not show saved changes properly and will intermittently close/crash the program. The debug file is open when launching the program after a crash.  The program crashes in safe mode when I open my folder with the project I am working on.

[0725/210501:ERROR:crash_report_database_win.cc(412)] unexpected header

]
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Launch Application
2. Open Folder
3. Open index.html file
4. Open Stylesheet.css file
5. Use Key Command ctrl + SHIFT + H
6. (Optional) Make a change to the file in Atom
7. Use Key Command ctrl +S

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
The file saves and the changes made will update in the html preview.
**Actual behavior:** 
Preview Window is dark and blank
App will close the program
### Versions

Atom : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome: 47.0.2526.110
Node: 5.1.1

Windows 7
Version 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1 Build 7601

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: Experiment: import APM into the atom repo
data.body:
⚠️  This may be a terrible idea ⚠️ 

This adds `apm` (with all of its history) into this repo, under the `apm` directory. The idea is that `apm` should just be a part of Atom, rather than its own node module that needs to _find_ Atom on your hard drive in order to work properly.

/cc @nathansobo

data.title: Revert "Use apm@1.12.2 with Node v4 and npm v3 \o/"
data.body:
Reverts atom/atom#11897

/cc @as-cii @BinaryMuse

data.title: Remove OS X from Travis Build Matrix
data.body: We are going to use CircleCI for OS X builds, so this pull-request changes Travis to build Atom only on Linux.

data.title: Delete .travis.yml
data.body: After #12207, we are going to switch atom/atom to use CircleCI. The web hook remains in-place for existing pull-requests, but from now on we won't be building new PRs on Travis.

data.title: Disable autosubmit of crash reporter
data.body: Disabling the crash reporter's autosubmit and removing the current endpoint as it is down.

data.title: Uncaught Invalid string interpolation at 2162
data.body:
Was in the process of converting a SCSS file to SASS... given this block of CSS declarations:

``` sass
.text-bg-red background-color: #D61E1E 
.text-bg-green 
background-color: #30853F 
.text-bg-pink background-color: #FF628C 
```

Error was triggered when pressing `tab` with the cursor in front of `background-color: #30853F`.

**Atom Version**: 1.8.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.5
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Invalid string interpolation at 2162

```
At /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/text-buffer.js:833

undefined
```
### Commands

```
 68x -0:35.9.0 find-and-replace:select-next (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:33.5.0 core:backspace (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
 70x -0:28 find-and-replace:select-next (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:25.8.0 core:backspace (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:18.1.0 editor:newline (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
  2x -0:17.4.0 emmet:expand-abbreviation-with-tab (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:06.9.0 editor:newline (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:06.2.0 core:move-up (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)

 15x -0:04.0 core:move-right (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
```

data.title: No support for horizontal scroll wheel
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

At the time being there's no support for a horizontal scroll wheel, something many programmers look for in a mouse these days. 
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Atom
2. Attempt to use horizontal scroll wheel on side of mouse
3. Sit and wonder if the mouse is broken for a good 2 minutes
4. Blame the tools for it not working

**Expected behavior:** page will horizontally scroll.

**Actual behavior:** Nothing
### Versions

Atom     : 1.8.0
Electron : 0.36.8
Chrome : 47.0.2526.110
Node     : 5.1.1
OS         : Windows 10 Pro

data.title: Block decorators don't work if `Use Shadow DOM` is false
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

The package [Hydrogen](https://github.com/nteract/hydrogen) uses block decorators. We've received a report that Hydrogen's block decorators are invisible when the setting `Use Shadow DOM` is false. See [this comment](https://github.com/nteract/hydrogen/issues/326#issuecomment-234727594).
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Install Hydrogen
2. Disable `Use Shadow DOM` under `Settings > Editor`
3. Run hydrogen, e.g. `hydrogen:run` on a line of python file.

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

a block decorator showing the result of running that python line

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

nothing happens
### Versions

```
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.10.0-dev-3a4e251
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
$ apm --version
apm  1.10.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.12
git 2.7.4
```

Also fails with Atom 1.8.0 and 1.9.0

data.title: Copy-Paste-Paste messes up indentation
data.body:
This is probably related to a number of other issues, but I think I've got a pretty clear example of exactly what doesn't work and consider it more appropriate to file as its own bug than as a comment to one of the others ( #4747, #5046, #9045, #10407, etc.).  Atom's behavior breaks what is for me a very basic, very common practice and I think I can provide test cases which spell out the problem pretty clearly.

I know that to duplicate a selection of lines I can type shift-cmd-D, and that's OK - I've learned to do it and I use it.  But I shouldn't need that command, because there is a technique I practice in every other text editor which does not require learning anything new.  That is Copy-Paste-Paste.  That is:
select entire lines of text (with triple-click-drag or cmd-left, shift-down, shift-down)
1. copy (do not change the selection at this point)
2. paste (pastes content in place, leaving selection at the start of the next line)
3. paste again (pastes a copy after the original, indented identically to the original)

Or, in shorthand, cmd-CVV.  In my experience, this is a universally successful way of accomplishing a frequently useful operation, except for atom.  Here's what goes wrong when I try it with atom.

In step 2, instead of pasting the content in place, it outdents the selection to the left margin.  In step 2, instead of pasting the second copy indented identically, it indents it by the indentation of the final line of the block.  That is, if the final line was indented 8 spaces more than the first line, it indents my second pasted block by 8 spaces.  If I paste again, it adds yet another level of indentation.

This is something I do under many circumstances, but probably the most common are to add a new "case" block to a switch statement or to duplicate a small function.

I'm sure this behavior is the result of enabling some other, desirable, behavior, but this is not behavior I would want or can imagine wanting under any circumstances.  When I copy-paste in place, I do not believe the pasted code should have changed in any way.

data.title: Atom Beta gets stuck in auto-update loop.
data.body:
### Description

Atom 1.9.0-beta1 gets stuck in a restart-to-install loop. I know 1.9b1 is not the latest but considering the nature of this bug, I suppose experiencing it on the latest build would be impossible.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Atom menu
2. Click 'Restart to install update'
3. Atom restarts
4. The Atom menu shows that the same update is downloading again.

**Expected behavior:** Atom should install the update it downloads and see that there are no newer versions.

**Actual behavior:** In addition to the steps above, this behavior repeats even after downloading the beta disk image from the atom website.
### Versions

```
OS X: 10.11.6 (15G31)

$ atom-beta -v
Atom    : 1.9.0-beta1
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

$ apm-beta -v
apm : 1.10.0
npm:  2.13.3
node: 0.10.40
python: 2.7.11
git: 2.8.1
```

data.title: 🐛 fix #12187
data.body: This fixes issue #12187 with the command `editor:move-to-beginning-of-screen-line` when used on indented soft-wrapped lines. I've testing it with soft-wrapping on and off, with no indentation, one level of indentation, and multiple levels of indentation, and it seems to give the expected behavior.
